query: Compare three scenarios for Europe datacenter UPS transition: baseline, accelerated Li-ion cost decline, and delayed adoption. Show how each affects the tipping point and 2035 market share
expected_behavior: Step 1: Runs forecast for Europe baseline scenario (standard cost trajectories)
Step 2: Runs forecast for Europe accelerated scenario (faster Li-ion decline, -12% CAGR vs -8%)
Step 3: Runs forecast for Europe delayed scenario (slower Li-ion decline, -5% CAGR)
Step 4: Uses compare_scenarios.py to generate comparative analysis
Baseline shows tipping point around 2029, Li-ion share ~75-80% by 2035
Accelerated scenario shows earlier tipping (~2026), higher adoption ~88-92% by 2035
Delayed scenario shows later tipping (~2032), lower adoption ~60-70% by 2035
Generates comparison showing differential impact on tipping point year (±3 years range)
Shows adoption rate differences: steeper S-curve for accelerated, flatter for delayed
Demonstrates cost sensitivity: 4 pp change in CAGR → ~3 year shift in tipping
Creates comparative visualization showing three adoption curves
Report includes absolute differences in Li-ion market share by year
Shows that total market demand similar across scenarios (driven by datacenter growth)
Technology mix varies significantly: accelerated has 30 pp higher Li-ion share by 2035
Output demonstrates understanding that cost trajectories drive tipping point timing
All three scenarios show eventual Li-ion dominance, but timing and extent differ
